intro: Licania oligantha, commonly known as the Brazilian licania, is a climbing shrub native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Licania oligantha is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of the rainforest.
